title: Arsene Wenger reveals Mesut Ozil heartbroken by Arsenal’s Champions League demise against Bayern Munich
text:
Mesut Ozil has been suffering with illness of late but is expected to start against West Brom on Saturday (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger has revealed Mesut Ozil was left devastated by Arsenal’s Champions League destruction at the hands of Bayern Munich.
Wenger embarrasses himself by comparing Arsenal flop to Kante The Gunners suffered a humbling 10-2 aggregate defeat after back-to-back 5-1 maulings at the hands of the German champions.
Ozil was heavily criticised for his performance in the first leg and was only introduced as a late substitute in the return game having only just recovered from illness.
Arsenal were thumped 10-2 on aggregate in the Champions League by Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) ‘He was ill and very disappointed by the fact we had gone out of the Champions League. But since he has arrived here, he has made very big strides forward,’ said Wenger.
‘We have been focusing on everybody doing their job offensively and defensively.
‘I believe that, instead of just highlighting one player, it’s important that everybody does it when it’s wanted from the game.
Mesut Ozil has denied his future at Arsenal is dependent on Arsene Wenger signing a new contract (Picture: Getty) I think we have to focus on collective performance rather than to expect anything special from one individual. Even if it’s Ozil, I believe we have to focus on our fighting spirit, togetherness and the way we want to play football.’
Earlier this week Ozil distanced himself from recent comments suggesting his future at Arsenal was dependent on whether or not Wenger remains as Arsenal boss and claimed he maintained a desire to win Europe’s biggest prize with the Gunners.
